article.title: Light Axinos from Freeze-in: production processes, phase space distributions, and Ly-$α$ constraints

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following processes does the LEFT panel of Figure 1 illustrate?
choices: 2-body decay of the lighter Higgs
Higgsino s-channel scattering
2-body decay of the Higgsino
3-body decay of the wino

multiple_choice_question.text: The RIGHT panel of Figure 2 demonstrates the impact of which of the following on the axino phase space distributions from 2-body decay?
choices: Decaying particle spin and a mass spectrum
Initial momentum of decaying particles
Reheating temperature variations
Varying axion coupling strength

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the LEFT panel of Figure 3, which realistic scenario produces the coldest phase space distribution for axinos?
choices: Higgsino NLSP
Wino NLSP with TR = 1 TeV
Wino NLSP with TR = 100 GeV
Wino NLSP with TR = 50 GeV

multiple_choice_question.text: The LEFT panel of Figure 4 indicates that the 7 keV axino DM relics from which of the following production processes are inconsistent with the Ly-α forest constraint of mWDM ≥ 3.3 keV?
choices: Higgsino 2-body decay and t-channel scattering
Higgsino 2-body decay and s-channel scattering
Higgsino s-channel scattering and wino 3-body decay
Wino 3-body decay and Higgsino t-channel scattering

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5 demonstrates the impact of entropy production on 7 keV axino DM models.  What is the primary effect of including entropy production in these models?
choices: It increases the cutoff scale of the matter power spectrum.
It eliminates the need for a dilution factor to satisfy Ly-α forest constraints.
It reduces the difference between the phase space distributions of axino DM and conventional WDM.
It significantly alters the shape of the phase space distribution of axinos.

multiple_choice_question.text: Table I displays the dimensionless divergence (˜σ) calculated from different axino production processes.  What role does ˜σ play in determining the lower bound on the DM mass in non-conventional models (such as axino DM)?
choices: It has no impact on the mass bound calculation.
It adjusts the mass bound based on the warmness of the specific production process.
It determines the temperature of the DM particles.
It quantifies the entropy dilution factor required to satisfy Ly-α forest constraints.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 11 provides the axino yield from scattering with gauge particles in the SUSY limit.  Which of the following statements is TRUE about this yield (Yscat\na)?
choices: It is independent of the reheating temperature (TR).
It is inversely proportional to the square of the PQ breaking scale (vPQ).
It is only relevant for models where the Higgsino is the NLSP.
It is significantly suppressed when the SUSY is broken.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 23 connects the lower bounds on the mass of thermally distributed (conventional) WDM and non-thermally distributed DM.  What essential factor does this formula incorporate to establish the relationship between these two mass bounds?
choices: The difference in the number of effective massless degrees of freedom.
The characteristic velocities of the DM particles.
The dimensionless divergence of the phase space distribution.
The entropy dilution factor after DM decoupling.
